title: Apparent "leaks" about Riot's upcoming plans for champs and skins
body:
So there was a supposed big "leak" about Riot's upcoming plans on a particular website and I have my doubts as to the legitimacy of them but here's a snippet. Basically it's a bunch of posts detailing every champion and whether or not Riot has plans for them with these posts tacked on at the end. I'd screenshot them all but that's a lot of time to waste.
But in the unlikely event that it ends up being true there are some things that seem off that I'm hoping don't actually come to fruition.
Xayah and Rakan don't need two sets of skins next year. That's absurd. 
I hope to god that Galio, Urgot, Garen, and Darius are not actually contenders for Star Guardian skins when you still have girls like Caitlyn, Sona, Vi, Ashe, Karma, etc...etc...that all could fit the aesthetic way better. 
There's supposedly talk of "supreme" skins that seem story driven by the idea of various characters conquering Runeterra. Namely Aatrox, Syndra, and Swain but the details of all of them is that they resemble the base look with some minor VFX/model changes. Which seems pointless then. 
Please do not actually make a Battle Royale mode. 
And the "reverse" skins seem lazy. 
Everyone will have their own opinions on it of course but seriously some of these plans seem ridiculous and I get they would be tentative if any of this was true in the first place.

replies.body: Gonna call BS on it.

I'm on the fence. I remember all too well the leak that seemed beyond ridiculous that announced a double champion release and other champions getting Pulsefire skins ended up being real and accurate down to the last detail.

All in all, this leak seems like tame, safe bets, with the craziest part being "Riot's trying different game modes, but they might not go through with them." That could indicate someone with no clue what's going on trying to seem believable, or it could just be Riot doing what sells.

> All in all, this leak seems like tame, safe bets, with the craziest part being "Riot's trying different game modes, but they might not go through with them." That could indicate someone with no clue what's going on trying to seem believable, or it could just be Riot doing what sells.

The previous leak turned out to be uber false, as it tried to sell us a Sword Journey Nami and Aurelion Sol, as well as trying to cram Heimerdinger and Urgot into the Omega Squad skin lines. So while they're sometimes right, I think more leaks have been wrong.

What's telling that this "leak" is probably a steaming pile of BS is that it specifically uses triggers for the community, such as the "painter mage," a popular boards theory and concept, which isn't in line with any of the teasers we've seen with the flower and footprint. Then there's a storm mage based on "Ao Shin," which is just _wrong_ since Ao Shin was early concept that became Aurelion Sol - so any storm mage isn't going to be based on Ao Shin, they'll be based on a storm mage concept (as if Janna somehow isn't already filling those shoes?). Furthermore, it also lists Taric and _Urgot_ as investigative candidates for the Star Guardians - Taric, I understand, but Urgot? I think Riot's made it _abundantly clear_ that this meme will stay dead.
Then there's the Camille skin - we already KNOW Camille is getting a skin before this year ends, that's been confirmed by Riot - so telling us she's got another skin in the works seems like it's just trying to feed us stuff we want to hear.

So yeah, there may be grains of truth that pop up sometimes, but this one is not one of them. It's pure make believe BS.

Honestly that sounds like waaay too many champs to be in the works and the leak doesn't even mention the chain champion.

I mean it mentions 8 champs being in the works(none of which seem to be the chain-champ,which would mean that there are 9 in the works),but Riot only releases around ~9 new champs+ VGUs every year,so that would mean that we'd get like 7 champs next year and only 2-3 reworks,which seems a bit low,even if they want to reduce the number of VGUs for the next year.

Not to mention that it mentions a Camille skin,even though Camille is already getting a new skin in the next PBE cycle.
The "beast controller" could be the chain champion.
True,but even then it would feel like just too many champions,which would mean a huge decline in VGU-releases.

Since some of those concepts are extremely vague, I assume they would be far off champions that aren't currently in immediate development. Just general ideas like "hey what about a champion that does this", "cool lets add that to the board".

I believe the schedule is mage champion, Kayle & Morg, chain champion, but maybe I'm forgetting someone from the roadmap.

I very seriously doubt they would release all those champions in succession, though. I also very seriously doubt any of those champions are real, besides the mage and beast controller, since they seem to fit with the current teasers we have. We'll see, though.

The "leak" specifically says that the dragon(who sounds far too similar to Ashen lord Aurelion Sol), armor conjurer, beast master, Totem-support, the abjurer mage,blade adc(sounds like Irelia as an ADC) and the fisherman are all in development.

Only the later concepts are still in early ideation.

The problem with that is the chained champ is implied that he/she are the ones imprisoned not that they have something else imprisoned. 

>we have another new champion locked away, with no release date in sight…

Not to mention the photo makes it looks like human or humanoid character and not a beast.

I mean, its probably the person, but remember Pyke's teaser? We thought he might be a sea monster or something, but it was really him looking out from his sunken ship at a sea monster. Perhaps the person isn't the champion. Perhaps we are seeing from the champion's perspective, and the person is the one imprisoning them.

Looking at the chains, they don't appear to be connected to the person's ankles like you think they would be on a prisoner. So, either the person is holding the chains, or the chains are secured around their wrists. Even then, though, the angle of the chains makes me think that the wrists are secured separately, which I don't think would be idle for keeping a prisoner. It makes it too easy for them to escape/harm their captor(look how that worked out with Alistar). Unless the chains are part of their attire/attached to them some other way, in which case, it might work.

Maybe its not a beast master, but its probably not the person we see either. We just have to wait and see. I believe the Chain Champion is coming after Kayle & Morgana's update, but I hope we hear something about both champions soon.
